poem:
Outbreak in Spartanburg  

An unseen feather flutters—  
in the air, a silent ripple.  
In Spartanburg's quiet pews,  
a congregation gathers sorrow,  
thanksgiving punctured by silence.  
The unvaccinated—  
growing numbers like shadows  
cast by morning—  
what we breathe,  
unasked, unmasked,  
is it faith or fever's chill whisper?  
We count the uncounted,  
listening for healing.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "South Carolina officials report ‘accelerating’ measles outbreak South Carolina health officials have reported an “accelerating” measles outbreak in the state in the wake of Thanksgiving travel and a lack of vaccinations, with hundreds of people in quarantine. The outbreak, which appears centered on a single church and several schools in Spartanburg county in the state’s north-west, according to an epidemiologist for the state’s department of public health, totaled 111 cases. Of those, 105 were unvaccinated". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: South Carolina officials report ‘accelerating’ measles outbreak South Carolina health officials have reported an “accelerating” measles outbreak in the state in the wake of Thanksgiving travel and a lack of vaccinations, with hundreds of people in quarantine. The outbreak, which appears centered on a single church and several schools in Spartanburg county in the state’s north-west, according to an epidemiologist for the state’s department of public health, totaled 111 cases. Of those, 105 were unvaccinated
